snippet: Eric T. Schneiderman, the New York attorney general, wants Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to give him the authority to handle cases in the deaths of unarmed civilians.
abstract: New York Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman looks to Gov Andrew M Cuomo to allow his office to investigate and prosecute law enforcement officials involved in killings of unarmed civilians; calls on state legislators to pass laws to return public confidence to criminal justice system.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and J. David Goodman from New York. Al Baker contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Eric T. Schneiderman, the New York attorney general, wants Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to give him the authority to handle cases in the deaths of unarmed civilians.

headline.main: New York Attorney General Seeks Powers to Investigate Killings by the Police
headline.print_headline: State Attorney General Seeks Powers to Investigate Killings by the Police
